Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION TRUST OF SARASOTA COUNTY

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Providing stewardship to our communities, enabling caring people and organizations to increase their ability to serve. For Good. For Ever.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Providing stewardship to our communities, enabling caring people and organizations to increase their ability to serve. For Good. For Ever.
IRS990.Description: Grants: The Foundation gave out 58 grants totaling $1,369,562 to various nonprofit organizations. These grants averaged $23,613 and were given for education, mental health, eldercare, animal welfare and the environment as well as providing needed program support for local agencies.

Activity2.Description: Scholarships: The Foundation awarded 262 scholarships totaling $638,758 from eight scholarship funds to new and returning college students.

Activity3.Description: The Nonprofit Resource Center (NRC): The NRC conducted 84 trainings covering nonprofit management, fund development, governance, volunteer management and other topics. Over 2,000 attendees representing 450 organizations attended these workshops. The NRC also runs an online job bank, in which 209 job openings were posted for local agencies. The NRC's resource library had over 112 reference books checked out during the year and the NRC's database of grantmakers scheduled 93 sessions with local nonprofit staff and volunteers. The NRC also offers over 200 digital resources including links to capacity building websites and articles about nonprofit management.

ActivityOther.Description: Building: The foundation offers its meeting and conference rooms free of charge to local nonprofit organizations. During this fiscal year there were 44 nonprofit groups with 3,338 individuals that used the building for 117 staff meetings, board retreats, workshops, etc.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grantees are required to submit written final reports in a specific format upon completion of the grant or 13 months from the time the grant is awarded, whichever comes first. Exceptions are made for operating grants from donor advised funds.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Review by Vice President of Finance & Administration and President & CEO; Review by Audit Committee with recommendation to Board of Directors for approval before filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually the board are required to fill out a conflict of interest questionnaire which is reviewed upon receipt by the President/CEO and again during the audit process.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive committee of the Board of Directors annually reviews and determines the compensation package of the President/CEO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST
The Organization has an audit committee that is charged with oversight of the audit and makes recommendations to the Board of Directors on selection of audit firms.
